{{also|折箭为誓}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=折箭为誓|type=211}}

===Etymology===
Literally: break an arrow in half in order (to seal a) promise
: The implication was that if one broke one's promise, one's fate would be similar to that of the arrow's.
